alert.note: Alert for Barrow; Clarke; Greene; Morgan; Newton; Oconee; Oglethorpe; Walton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 9:30AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Oconee, southeastern Barrow, central Morgan, Clarke, northeastern Walton, northwestern Greene, northwestern Oglethorpe and southeastern Newton Counties through 945 AM EDT... At 930 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Farmington, or 7 miles southwest of Watkinsville, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Madison, Watkinsville, Athens, Statham, Winterville, Bogart, Rutledge, Newborn, North High Shoals, Mansfield, Arnoldsville, Good Hope, Bishop, Athens-Clarke County, Whitehall, Beechwood Hills, Wrayswood, Eastville and Barnett Shoals. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Barrow; Clarke; Greene; Morgan; Newton; Oconee; Oglethorpe; Walton
